remarks: Any upper bound on the values of a linear operator translates to an upper bound on the operator norm.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Oct-2015.)
statement:

nmofval.2 $e |- V = ( Base ` S ) $.
nmofval.3 $e |- L = ( norm ` S ) $.
nmofval.4 $e |- M = ( norm ` T ) $.
nmolb $p |- ( ( ( S e. NrmGrp /\ T e. NrmGrp /\ F e. ( S GrpHom T ) ) /\ A e. RR /\ 0 <_ A ) -> ( A. x e. V ( M ` ( F ` x ) ) <_ ( A x. ( L ` x ) ) -> ( N ` F ) <_ A ) ) $.

$d F x $.
